ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: FERC Electric Tariff First Revised Volume No. 3

record_data.record_title: FERC Electric Tariff First Revised Volume No. 3
record_data.record_plain_text: RATE SCHEDULE WS-HV1 WHOLESALE SERVICE TRANSMISSION SERVICE AVAILABILITY OF SCHEDULE This Rate Schedule applies to electric service sold to municipal and affiliated Customers, and new connection points served on or after June 25, 1995, who purchase electric energy for resale. Service will be supplied under an Electric Service Agreement setting forth the financial conditions covering the extension of service, the period of service and the conditions of supply. CHARACTER OF SERVICE DELIVERED UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Alternating current service having the following characteristics: 34,500 volts and over, 60 cycles, three-phase. CHARGES UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Customers served will be rendered a monthly bill covering the maximum kilowatts of demand and kilowatthours furnished by the Company for the Customer s use as follows: Customer Charge $409.00 Net Kilowatt Demand Charge $10.538 Net per Kilowatt Energy Charge $0.01895 Net per Kilowatthour Voltage Discount If requested, the Company will furnish Service at 138,000 volts at a location if such Service at that location is over 10,000 kilowatts, is provided at a single delivery point from the Company s transmission system, is the only Service on that account, and if, in the sole judgment of the Company, the necessary capacity is available. When such Service is supplied and the Customer owns and maintains all facilities, except metering equipment, required to take service at 138,000 volts, the following discounts will be allowed, but in no case will the amount of the minimum bill be hereby reduced. First 10,000 kilowatts of Customer s Demand . . . $0.60 Net per Kilowatt Additional kilowatts of Customer s Demand . . . . $0.08 net per Kilowatt To qualify for this transmission voltage Service, the Customer must be billed for at least 10,000 kilowatts at least once in every 12-month period at each metering point. Tax Adjustment In the event there is a change in the Company s cost of service resulting from a change in federal income taxes or federal income tax rates, the Company shall adjust its rates, subject to the filing requirements of Part 35 of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission s regulations, to reflect this change in federal income tax expense. Stranded Investment If any of the Customers terminate or cancel service under the Tariff, Potomac Edison may seek to hold such Customer responsible for its share of any legitimate and verifiable stranded costs related to the service which such Customer purchases from Potomac Edison as may be permitted by applicable federal or state rules and regulations, policies or interpretations, and in accordance with any regulations or policies issued by FERC in relation to its pending Notice of Proposed Rulemaking and Supplemental Notice of Proposed Rulemaking issued March 29, 1995 at 70 FERC 61,357. Such costs shall be subject to review by appropriate governmental agency(s). Any such Customer shall not be estopped from objecting to and defending against any such claim for stranded costs brought by Potomac Edison. The inclusion of this language in the Tariff shall not constitute an admission by the Customer of the propriety of the collection of any stranded costs. Fuel Cost Adjustment A fuel cost adjustment shall apply to all kilowatthours billed under this Rate Schedule. The adjustment shall be determined by the following formula to the nearest 0.001 cent per kilowatthour: A = Fm - Fb x L x 1 Sm Sb 1 - T A= Fuel cost adjustment in cents per kilowatthour. Fm = Fuel cost in the current period relating to: (a)Fossil and nuclear fuel consumed in generation in wholly-owned and jointly-owned stations and identifiable fossil and nuclear fuel costs in energy purchased, plus the net energy cost of energy purchased on an economic dispatch basis, less (b)Fossil and nuclear fuel costs recovered through intersystem sales. All fuel costs will be those charged to Account 501, cleared through Account 151 and Account 518 in the second calendar month preceding the billing month. Sm = All killowatthour sales to regular customers in the current period. Fb and Sb= Fuel cost and kilowatthour sales in the base period as defined above. The factor Fb = 1.200 cents per kilowatthour. Sb L = Adjustment factor to recognize losses to service voltage where different than average losses in the delivery system. This factor is 0.97. T = The jurisdictional Gross Receipts Tax rate in effect during the billing month, expressed as a decimal. MINIMUM BILL UNDER THIS SCHEDULE The minimum bill under this Rate Schedule shall be the demand charge as provided under Charges Under This Schedule applied to the minimum demand, which shall not be less than 500 kilowatts or not less than one-half the highest demand created during the current contract period for which the Customer has taken service under this Rate Schedule, whichever is higher. The demand period shall be 60 minutes. OTHER PROVISIONS When a Customer has a number of service connections which could be or are interconnected, the coincident kilowatt demand and kilowatthours delivered to the Customer will be added and minor energy return to the Company subtracted and the net kilowatt demand and kilowatthours will be billed to Customer In taking service from the Company under this Rate Schedule, the Customer agrees that the load imposed by the Customer on the Company s electrical system shall have approximately the same or higher load factor and power factor as that experienced by the Customer for the Customer s entire load. Bills remaining unpaid thirty days from the day of mailing shall thereafter bear simple interest at the rate of one-half of one percent per month. APPLICABLE GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS Articles 1 through 14 of the Company s Rules and Regulations which govern the supply of wholesale service, as included in the FERC Tariff and as changed from time to time, apply to this Rate Schedule and are hereby incorporated by reference. This Rate Schedule is made subject to the jurisdiction of any governmental authorities having jurisdiction in the premises, and either party may, at any time or from time to time, unilaterally take any action before or with such authorities with respect to any rates, terms, conditions or services of this Rate Schedule that it deems desirable, and in such event, the rates, terms or conditions under which service shall be rendered hereunder shall be those authorized by such authorities.
record_data.filing_title: Potomac Edison First Revised Volume No. 3 Baseline filing

record_data.record_title: FERC Electric Tariff First Revised Volume No. 3
record_data.record_plain_text: RATE SCHEDULE WS-LV1 WHOLESALE SERVICE DISTRIBUTION SERVICE AVAILABILITY OF SCHEDULE This Rate Schedule applies to electric service sold to municipal and affiliated Customers, and new connection points served on or after June 25, 1995, who purchase electric energy for resale. Service will be supplied under an Electric Service Agreement setting forth the financial conditions covering the extension of service, the period of service and the conditions of supply. CHARACTER OF SERVICE DELIVERED UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Alternating current service having the following characteristics: 4,160 and 12,470 volts, 60 cycles, three-phase. CHARGES UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Customers served will be rendered a monthly bill covering the maximum kilowatt of demand and kilowatthours furnished by the Company for the Customer s use as follows: Customer Charge $149.00 Net Kilowatt Demand Charge $11.279 Net per Kilowatt Energy Charge $0.01884 Net per Kilowatthour Tax Adjustment In the event there is a change in the Company s cost of service resulting from a change in federal income taxes or federal income tax rates, the Company shall adjust its rates, subject to the filing requirements of Part 35 of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission s regulations, to reflect this change in federal income tax expense. Stranded Investment If any of the Customers terminate or cancel service under the Tariff, Potomac Edison may seek to hold such Customer responsible for its share of any legitimate and verifiable stranded costs related to the service which such Customer purchases from Potomac Edison as may be permitted by applicable federal or state rules and regulations, policies or interpretations, and in accordance with any regulations or policies issued by FERC in relation to its pending Notice of Proposed Rulemaking and Supplemental Notice of Proposed Rulemaking issued March 29, 1995 at 70 FERC 61,357. Such costs shall be subject to review by appropriate governmental agency(s). Any such Customer shall not be estopped from objecting to and defending against any such claim for stranded costs brought by Potomac Edison. The inclusion of this language in the Tariff shall not constitute an admission by the Customer of the propriety of the collection of any stranded costs. Fuel Cost Adjustment A fuel cost adjustment shall apply to all kilowatthours billed under this Rate Schedule. The adjustment shall be determined by the following formula to the nearest 0.001 cent per kilowatthour: A = Fm - Fb x L x 1 Sm Sb 1 - T A= Fuel cost adjustment in cents per kilowatthour. Fm = Fuel cost in the current period relating to: (a)Fossil and nuclear fuel consumed in generation in wholly-owned and jointly-owned stations and identifiable fossil and nuclear fuel costs in energy purchased, plus the net energy cost of energy purchased on an economic dispatch basis, less (b)Fossil and nuclear fuel costs recovered through intersystem sales. All fuel costs will be those charged to Account 501, cleared through Account 151 and Account 518 in the second calendar month preceding the billing month. Sm = All killowatthour sales to regular Customers in the current period. Fb and Sb= Fuel cost and kilowatthour sales in the base period as defined above. The factor Fb = 1.200 cents per kilowatthour. Sb L = Adjustment factor to recognize losses to service voltage where different than average losses in the delivery system. This factor is 1.00. T = The jurisdictional Gross Receipts Tax rate in effect during the billing month, expressed as a decimal. MINIMUM BILL UNDER THIS SCHEDULE The minimum bill under this Rate Schedule shall be the demand charge as provided under Charges Under This Schedule applied to the minimum demand, which shall not be less than 100 kilowatts or not less than one-half the highest demand created during the current contract period for which the Customer has taken service under this Rate Schedule, whichever is higher. The demand period shall be 30 minutes. OTHER PROVISIONS In taking service from the Company under this Rate Schedule, the Customer agrees that the load imposed by the Customer on the Company s electrical system shall have approximately the same or higher load factor and power factor as that experienced by the Customer for the Customer s entire load. Bills remaining unpaid thirty days from the day of mailing shall thereafter bear simple interest at the rate of one-half of one percent per month. APPLICABLE GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS Articles 1 through 14 of the Company s Rules and Regulations which govern the supply of wholesale service, as included in the FERC Tariff and as changed from time to time, apply to this Rate Schedule and are hereby incorporated by reference. This Rate Schedule is made subject to the jurisdiction of any governmental authorities having jurisdiction in the premises, and either party may, at any time or from time to time, unilaterally take any action before or with such authorities with respect to any rates, terms, conditions or services of this Rate Schedule that it deems desirable, and in such event, the rates, terms or conditions under which service shall be rendered hereunder shall be those authorized by such authorities.

record_data.record_title: FERC Electric Tariff First Revised Volume No. 3
record_data.record_plain_text: RATE SCHEDULE WS-DV1 WHOLESALE SERVICE BORDERLINE SERVICE AVAILABILITY OF SCHEDULE This Rate Schedule applies to electric service sold to municipal and affiliated Customers, and new connection points served on or after June 25, 1995, who purchase electric energy for resale, delivered from the General Distribution System of the Company where capacity and facilities are available. Service under this Rate Schedule is for so-called Borderline service where the buyer and the seller mutually agree to supply each other with service. Service will be supplied under an Electric Service Agreement setting forth the financial conditions covering the extension of service, the period of service and the conditions of supply. CHARACTER OF SERVICE DELIVERED UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Alternating current service having the following characteristics: 2,400, 4,160, 7,200 and 12,470 volts, 60 cycles, single and three-phase. At the option of the company, lower voltages may be used subject to correction for losses to the primary delivery voltages specified. CHARGES UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Customers served will be rendered a monthly bill covering the kilowatt-hours furnished by the Company for the Customer s use as follows: Customer Charge $665.00 Net Energy Charge $0.04479 Net per Kilowatthour Tax Adjustment In the event there is a change in the Company s cost of service resulting from a change in federal income taxes or federal income tax rates, the Company shall adjust its rates, subject to the filing requirements of Part 35 of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission s regulations, to reflect this change in federal income tax expense. Stranded Investment If any of the Customers terminate or cancel service under the Tariff, Potomac Edison may seek to hold such Customer responsible for its share of any legitimate and verifiable stranded costs related to the service which such Customer purchases from Potomac Edison as may be permitted by applicable federal or state rules and regulations, policies or interpretations, and in accordance with any regulations or policies issued by FERC in relation to its pending Notice of Proposed Rulemaking and Supplemental Notice of Proposed Rulemaking issued March 29, 1995 at 70 FERC 61,357. Such costs shall be subject to review by appropriate governmental agency(s). Any such Customer shall not be estopped from objecting to and defending against any such claim for stranded costs brought by Potomac Edison. The inclusion of this language in the Tariff shall not constitute an admission by the Customer of the propriety of the collection of any stranded costs. Fuel Cost Adjustment A fuel cost adjustment shall apply to all kilowatthours billed under this Rate Schedule. The adjustment shall be determined by the following formula to the nearest 0.001 cent per kilowatthour: A = Fm - Fb x L Sm Sb A= Fuel cost adjustment in cents per kilowatthour. Fm = Fuel cost in the current period relating to: (a)Fossil and nuclear fuel consumed in generation in wholly-owned and jointly-owned stations and identifiable fossil and nuclear fuel costs in energy purchased, plus the net energy cost of energy purchased on an economic dispatch basis, less (b)Fossil and nuclear fuel costs recovered through intersystem sales. All fuel costs will be those charged to Account 501, cleared through Account 151 and Account 518 in the second calendar month preceding the billing month. Sm = All killowatthour sales to regular Customers in the Current Period. Fb and Sb= Fuel cost and kilowatthour sales in the base period as defined above. The factor Fb = 1.200 cents per kilowatthour. Sb L = Adjustment factor to recognize losses to service voltage where different than average losses in the delivery system. This factor is 1.00. MINIMUM BILL UNDER THIS SCHEDULE The minimum bill under this Rate Schedule shall not be less than one-half of the highest bill during the last preceding twelve months that the Customer has taken service under this Rate Schedule. OTHER PROVISIONS When a Customer has a number of service connections, the kilowatthours delivered will be added for billing purposes. When service is measured at less than delivery voltage, the measurement shall be adjusted for losses to the point of delivery. In taking service from the Company under this Rate Schedule, the Customer agrees that the load imposed by the Customer on the Company s electrical system shall have approximately the same or higher load factor and power factor as that experienced by the Customer for the Customer s entire load. Bills remaining unpaid thirty days from the day of mailing shall thereafter bear simple interest at the rate of one-half of one percent per month. APPLICABLE GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS Articles 1 through 14 of the Company s Rules and Regulations which govern the supply of wholesale service, as included in this FERC Tariff and as changed from time to time, apply to this Rate Schedule and are hereby incorporated by reference. This Rate Schedule is made subject to the jurisdiction of any governmental authorities having jurisdiction in the premises, and either party may, at any time or from time to time, unilaterally take any action before or with such authorities with respect to any rates, terms, conditions or services of this Rate Schedule that it deems desirable, and in such event, the rates, terms of conditions under which service shall be rendered hereunder shall be those authorized by such authorities.

record_data.record_title: FERC Electric Tariff First Revised Volume No. 3
record_data.record_plain_text: ELECTRIC SERVICE AGREEMENT This Agreement, made this _______ day of ___________________, ____, by and between The Potomac Edison Company ( Company ), and __________________________, whose address is _______________________________________________, ( Customer ). W I T N E S S E T H: That for and in consideration of the covenants and agreements herein contained, it is mutually agreed as follows: 1.Company will supply or cause to be supplied to Customer, electric current for distribution by Customer to its retail customers. Such service will be supplied to the delivery points and at the capacity as shown in Appendix A hereof, as may be amended from time to time. 2.Customer agrees to take and pay for electric service supplied by Company in accordance with the Rules and Regulations and applicable Rate Schedule as set out in the Company s FERC Electric Tariff presently in effect, and as it may be amended from time to time. 3.The initial term of this Agreement, for each delivery point now or hereafter served under this Agreement, shall be three years from the date service commences at such delivery point with renewals of one year thereafter. This Agreement may be terminated at the end of the initial or any subsequent terms by either party giving three months prior written notice to the other of such termination. 4.Nothing contained herein shall be construed as affecting in any way the right of the party furnishing service under this rate schedule to unilaterally make application to the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission for a change in rates, charges, classification, or service, or any rule, regulation or contract relating thereto, under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act and pursuant to the Commission s Rules and Regulations promulgated thereunder. 5.This Agreement, together with the Rules and Regulations and applicable Rate Schedule constitutes the entire Contract between the Company and Customer, and supersedes and cancels all prior agreements as of the effective date hereof. 6.This Agreement shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the parties hereto and their successors and assigns. 7.Special Provisions: IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the parties hereto have caused this Agreement to be signed and sealed by their duly authorized officers. ATTEST: THE POTOMAC EDISON COMPANY CUSTOMER APPENDIX A Connection No. ________ Electric Service Specifications 1.Customer (name and business address): 2.Delivery Point (name, county, and state): 3.Effective Date: 4.Service Characteristics (a)Rate Schedule: (b)Delivery Voltage: (c)Delivery Point Precise Location: (d)Other Provisions: Customer By: Date: Title: THE POTOMAC EDISON COMPANY By: Date: Title:
record_data.filing_title: Potomac Edison First Revised Volume No. 3 Baseline filing

record_data.record_title: FERC Electric Tariff First Revised Volume No. 3
record_data.record_plain_text: RULES AND REGULATIONS The following Rules and Regulations govern the supply of wholesale service by The Potomac Edison Company. 1.Definitions 1.1Certain words, when used in the Rules and Regulations, Rate Schedules and Electric Service Agreements of The Potomac Edison Company, shall have the following meanings: 1.1.1 Appendix: Supplement to the Electric Service Agreement containing the service characteristics for delivery points. 1.1.2 Company : The Potomac Edison Company. 1.1.3 Customer: Any rural electric cooperative, municipality or electric utility to whom the Company may furnish wholesale service. 1.1.4 Electric Service Agreement: Form used as formal contract between the Company and the Customer stipulating term, conditions of service, and obligations of both parties. 1.1.5 Month : The period between two consecutive monthly meter readings taken as nearly as practicable, on the same date of each calendar month, as selected by the Company. 1.1.6 Rate Schedule: A rate which may be obtained by a Customer if his use of service conforms to the character of supply contemplated in the rate. 1.1.7 Service: Any electricity which the Company may supply or make provision to supply, or any work or material furnished or any obligation performed by the Company under its Rules and Regulations or Rate Schedules.. 2.Service Availability 2.1Character of Electric Service 2.1.1Depending upon the size and character, and geographic location of the Customer s load, the Company will supply from its overhead system, 60-cycle alternating current at three-phase and at one of the following voltages: Phase Voltage (Nominal) 3 4,160 3 12,470 3 34,500 3 69,000 3 138,000 2.1.2 Inasmuch as some of the above voltages are available only in certain sections of the territory served by the Company, it is necessary that the Customer consult the Company about the type of service that will be supplied before proceeding with the installation of wiring or the purchase of equipment. 2.2Capacity 2.2.1The Company s existing facilities have a limited capacity; therefore, to assure satisfactory operation of the Customer s facilities and to protect both the Customer s and the Company s facilities against damage, the Company must be advised of any substantial change in the amount or use of the Customer s load so that Company facilities of the proper capacity may be installed; provided however, that such change shall be subject to the availability of power on the Company s system and to agreement between the parties on such devices or arrangements as may be required to insure the reliability of both systems. The Customer shall pay for any damage or loss caused to the Company by violation of this provision. 2.3Liability 2.3.1The Customer, by accepting service from the company, assumes full responsibility for the safety and adequacy of the wiring and equipment installed on the Customer s system. The Customer agrees to indemnify and save the Company harmless from any liability which may arise as the result of the use of service supplied to the Customer by the Company 2.4Use of Equipment 2.4.1The Customer shall not operate nor permit the operation of any equipment creating a condition which prevents the Company from supplying satisfactory service to others. 3.Agreement for Service 3.1Each Customer shall enter into an Electric service Agreement of the form set out in this FERC Electric Tariff or such other form as may be required in cases involving the supply of emergency, standby or breakdown service. The initial term of this Electric Service Agreement, for each delivery point now or hereafter served, shall be three years from the date service commences at such delivery point with renewals of one year thereafter. This Electric Service Agreement may be terminated at the end of the initial or any subsequent terms by either party giving three months prior written notice to the other of such termination. 4.Right of Way 4.1The facilities of the Company, by which service is furnished, shall be located on or over easements along a route deemed by the Company to be the most suitable for the furnishing of such service. On property controlled by the Customer, the Customer shall provide the Company, free of cost, with satisfactory right-of-way and suitable location and housing for the Company s facilities necessary for supplying service to the Customer. It shall not be the obligation of the Company to acquire any rich or easement on or over property of another necessary for the furnishing of service to the Customer for which acquisition of the Company does not have the right of eminent domain. 5.Maintenance and Removal 5.1Facilities provided by the Company are the property of the Company and shall remain its property. The Customer shall permit the Company to inspect, maintain, repair, and remove the Company s facilities, at all reasonable h ours. 6.Customer s Facilities 6.1The Customer shall pay the cost of relocating its facilities if such relocation is necessary to conform with a relocation of the Company s facilities required by law or by public improvements. 7.Company s Facilities 7.1The Customer shall pay the cost of moving the Company s facilities if they are moved at the Customer s Request. 8.Continuity of Service 8.1The Company will use reasonable diligence in attempting to provide continuous service. The Company shall not be liable for any loss, cost, damage or expense caused by any failure to supply electricity according to the terms of a contract, or by any interruption of the supply of electricity, reversal of the service, variation in voltage or by any other failure, when such failures are due to acts of God, public enemies, accidents, strikes, riots, wars, extraordinary repairs, operating necessities, orders of Court or other Governmental authority, or to any other acts or conditions reasonably beyond the control of the Company. 8.2In the event of an emergency threatening the integrity of its system, the Company may without liability interrupt, curtail, or suspend service. 9.Emergency Load Control 9.1Whenever the demands for power on all or part of the Company s system exceed or threaten to exceed the capacity then actually and lawfully available to supply such demand, or whenever system instability or cascading outages could result from actual or expected transmission overloads or other contingencies, or whenever such conditions exist in the system of another public utility or power pool with which the Company s system is interconnected and cause a reduction in the capacity available to the company from that source or threaten the integrity of the Company s system, a load emergency situation exists. In such case, the Company shall take such reasonable steps as the time available permits to bring the demands within the then-available capacity or otherwise control load. Such steps shall include but shall not be limited to reduction or interruption of service to one or more customers, in accordance with the company s procedures for controlling load. 10.Metering 10.1For the purpose of measuring or obtaining such information as it may require for billing purposes, the Company may select and use any type of metering equipment, provided it meets the accuracy requirements of the appropriate regulatory agencies. 11.Connections with Other Power Sources 11.1If the Customer has an electrical power supply other than the Company s, no connection shall be made between that supply and the Company s facilities, except by written consent of the Company. Service supplied by the Company shall not be used for emergency, standby or breakdown service or as reserve service to another source of supply except where otherwise provided by contract or by the Company s written consent. 12.Billing and Payment 12.1Bills for service will be rendered at regular monthly intervals in accordance with the then effective applicable Rate Schedule set out in this FERC Electric Tariff and shall be due upon presentation. 12.2If service is supplied to the Customer while the metering is defective, the Customer shall pay for service on the basis of an estimate arrived at by a mutually satisfactory method. 12.3Late payment charges will be applied as provided in the applicable Rate Schedule set out in this FERC Electric Tariff if all previous undisputed bills have not been paid in full. If bills are paid by mail, the date of the postmark will be considered the date of payment. 13.Excess Facilities 13.1The rates in this tariff are based on the Customer connecting to existing facilities of the Company. If the Company is required to extend its lines or build any additional facilities beyond those required for normal service to enable it to render service as requested to the Customer, the Customer shall pay for the cost of such extensions or facilities in addition to its monthly bill for electric service. 14.Transfer of Electric Service Agreement 14.1The Electric Service Agreement between Customer and the Company is transferable only with the Company s written consent.

record_data.record_plain_text: COMPANY SERVICE The Potomac Edison Company is a public utility company engaged in the production, distribution and sale of electric energy in western Maryland and adjacent areas of eastern West Virginia and northern Virginia.
record_data.filing_title: Potomac Edison First Revised Volume No. 3 Baseline filing

record_data.record_title: FERC Electric Tariff First Revised Volume No. 3
record_data.record_plain_text: RATE SCHEDULE WS-DV WHOLESALE SERVICE BORDERLINE SERVICE Effective with all service rendered on or after June 25, 1995, Wholesale Service Borderline Service, Schedule WS-DV is hereby canceled and all Customers were transferred to Rate Schedule WS-DV1 .
record_data.filing_title: Potomac Edison First Revised Volume No. 3 Baseline filing

record_data.record_title: FERC Electric Tariff First Revised Volume No. 3
record_data.record_plain_text: NETWORK TRANSMISSION SERVICE A.Network Transmission Service: Customers cost of service is the product of (a) the Monthly Transmission Demand Revenue Requirement and, where appropriate, the Monthly Subtransmission Demand Revenue Requirements, and (b) Customer s Load Ratio Share, plus (c) Ancillary Services as listed in Section C below. B.Monthly Revenue Requirements 1.The Monthly Transmission Demand Revenue Requirement for the purpose of this tariff shall be $13,560,504. 2.The Monthly Subtransmission Demand Revenue Requirements for purposes of this tariff shall be $5,011,712. 3.The Monthly Load Following Service Revenue Requirement for purposes of this tariff shall be $1,310,618. 4.The Monthly Reactive Power/Voltage Control Service Revenue Requirement for purposes of this tariff shall be $4,622,847. 5.The Monthly Reserves service Revenue Requirement for purposes of this tariff shall be $3,377,776. C.Ancillary Services. In addition to the ancillary services listed below, AP offered under its Group One tariff, System Protection Service and Loss Service, which are not ancillary services under Order No. 888 and are, therefore, not included in AP s conforming tariff or this filing. AP did not include in its Group One tariff Scheduling, System Control and Dispatch Service; there is no itemized charge for this ancillary service under this tariff. The revenue requirements for this service are part of the basic transmission rate. Reactive Power/Voltage Control Service Demand Charge The monthly demand charge for this service shall be the product of customer s Load Ratio Share and the Monthly Reactive Power/Voltage Control Service Revenue Requirement listed above. Load Following Service (Regulation & Frequency Response Service) The Monthly demand charge for this service shall be the product of customer s Load Ratio Share and the Monthly Load Following Service Revenue Requirement listed above. Reserves Service (Operating Reserve-Spinning Reserve and operating Reserve -Supplemental Reserve Service) Customer shall pay a monthly demand and power charge for this service. The monthly demand charge shall be the product of Customer s Load Ratio Share and the Monthly Reserves Service Revenue Requirement listed in Section B above. Charges for power supplied as Reserves Service shall be the sum of: (1) the Company s out-of-pocket cost of providing operating capacity for Reserves Service in such month, and (2) Company s reserves requirement, and (3) Customer s peak network load during the month Reserves Service is purchased, and (4) the number of hours Reserves Service is purchased, plus (5) the product of (a) the Company s out-of-pocket cost of providing energy for Reserves Service in such month, if any, and (b) MWh of Reserves Service energy purchased, if any, in such month. Energy Imbalance Service If customer has chosen a Manual or Electronic Schedule (as described in the tariff) as its method of scheduling its reservation, any difference between the Manual or Electronic Schedule and the power actually delivered (after proper adjustment for losses) resulting in an hourly supply of power to Customer and measured at the specified point of receipt (POR) or point of delivery (POD) located within the APS control area shall be supplied as an Ancillary Service. In the case where Customer chooses a Dynamic Schedule, by definition there is no need for Customer to purchase this Ancillary Service from the Company while the Dynamic Schedule is fully functional. If the Dynamic Schedule fails to function, for at least one hour, Customer must purchase the Energy Imbalance Service Described herein. Customers that choose a Manual or Electronic Schedule will automatically purchase Energy Imbalance Service from the Company. Company shall establish a deviation band of a plus or minus 1.5 percent (difference between Manual or Electronic Schedule and actual delivery) to be applied hourly to measure the amount of energy imbalance that will be tolerated by the Company without monetary penalty. The amount of each hourly deviation within the deviation band will be aggregated during the on-peak1 and off-peak2 periods with appropriate cancellation between over and under generation amounts during each period. The Customer should attempt to eliminate energy imbalances within the limits of the deviation band by appropriate counter hourly scheduling of power during on-peak or off-peak periods as necessary to make the respective energy imbalance zero out. If an accumulated energy imbalance within the deviation band is not corrected within such calendar month or if an individual hourly imbalance is outside of the deviation band, the Customer will be charged as follows: (i)in the event Customer undersupplies power, payment due the Company shall be the greater of (1) $100 MWh of such power supplied, or (2) 110% of the out-of-pocket cost of supplying the power, or (ii)in the event Customer oversupplies power, the Company shall make payment for the power to Customer at a rate equal to 90% of the Company s then current decremental cost of not producing such power for Energy Imbalance Service.
record_data.filing_title: Potomac Edison First Revised Volume No. 3 Baseline filing

record_data.record_title: FERC Electric Tariff First Revised Volume No. 3
record_data.record_plain_text: RATE SCHEDULE WS-HV WHOLESALE SERVICE TRANSMISSION SERVICE AVAILABILITY OF SCHEDULE Available only to Customers served on or before June 25, 1995 for electric service sold to Customers who purchase electric energy for resale. Service will be supplied under an Electric Service Agreement setting forth the financial conditions covering the extension of service, the period of service and the conditions of supply. CHARACTER OF SERVICE DELIVERED UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Alternating current service having the following characteristics: 34,500 volts and over, 60 cycles, three-phase. CHARGES UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Customers served will be rendered a monthly bill covering the maximum kilowatts of demand and kilowatthours furnished by the Company for the Customer s use as follows: Transmission Charge Transmission services will be provided pursuant to a separate Service Agreement for Network Integration Transmission service under the Company s Pro Forma Open Access Transmission Tariff. Generation Charge $0.02320 Net per Kilowatthour Fuel Cost Adjustment A fuel cost adjustment shall apply to all kilowatthours billed under this Rate Schedule. The adjustment shall be $0.0000 per kilowatthour from January 1, 1997 to January 1, 2002. Beginning January 1, 2002, the adjustment shall be determined by the following formula to the nearest 0.001 cent per kilowatthour: A = Fm - Fb x L x 1 Sm Sb 1 - T A= Fuel cost adjustment in cents per kilowatthour. Fm = Fuel cost in the current period relating to: (a)Fossil and nuclear fuel consumed in generation in wholly-owned and jointly-owned stations and identifiable fossil and nuclear fuel costs in energy purchased, plus the net energy cost of energy purchased on an economic dispatch basis, less (b)Fossil and nuclear fuel costs recovered through intersystem sales. All fuel costs will be those charged to Account 501, cleared through Account 151 and Account 518 in the second calendar month preceding the billing month. Sm = All killowatthour sales to regular Customers in the Current Period. Fb and Sb= Fuel cost and kilowatthour sales in the base period as defined above. The factor Fb = 1.200 cents per kilowatthour. Sb L = Adjustment factor to recognize losses to service voltage where different than average losses in the delivery system. This factor is 0.97. T = The jurisdictional Gross Receipts Tax rate in effect during the billing month, expressed as a decimal. OTHER PROVISIONS When a Customer has a number of service connections which could be or are interconnected, the coincident kilowatt demand and kilowatthours delivered to the Customer will be added and minor energy return to the Company subtracted and the net kilowatt demand and kilowatthours will be billed to the Customer. In taking service from the Company under this Rate Schedule, the Customer agrees that the load imposed by the Customer on the Company s electrical system shall have approximately the same or higher load factor and power factor as that experienced by the Customer for the Customer s entire load. Bills remaining unpaid thirty days from the day of mailing shall thereafter bear simple interest at the rate of one-half of one percent per month. APPLICABLE GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS Articles 1 through 14, except Article 3.1 as modified later in this section, of the Company s Rules and Regulations which govern the supply of wholesale service, as included in the FERC Tariff and as changed from time to time, apply to this Rate Schedule and are hereby incorporated by reference. The initial term of the Electric Service Agreement, as contained in Article 3.1 of the Rules and Regulations of the Electric Tariff, is hereby modified: The initial term of the Electric Service Agreement shall be from January 1, 1997 to January 1, 2002. This Electric Service Agreement may be terminated at the end of the initial or subsequent terms by either party giving three months prior written notice to the other of such termination. This Rate Schedule is made subject to the jurisdiction of any governmental authorities having jurisdiction in the premises, and either party may, at any time or from time to time, unilaterally take any action before or with such authorities with respect to any rates, terms, conditions or services of this Rate Schedule that it deems desirable, and in such event, the rates, terms or conditions under which service shall be rendered hereunder shall be those authorized by such authorities.
record_data.filing_title: Potomac Edison First Revised Volume No. 3 Baseline filing

record_data.record_title: FERC Electric Tariff First Revised Volume No. 3
record_data.record_plain_text: RATE SCHEDULE WS-LV WHOLESALE SERVICE DISTRIBUTION SERVICE AVAILABILITY OF SCHEDULE Available only to Customers served on or before June 25, 1995 for electric service sold to Customers who purchase electric energy for resale. Service will be supplied under an Electric Service Agreement setting forth the financial conditions covering the extension of service, the period of service and the conditions of supply. CHARACTER OF SERVICE DELIVERED UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Alternating current service having the following characteristics: 4,160 and 12,470 volts, 60 cycles, three-phase. CHARGES UNDER THIS SCHEDULE Customers served will be rendered a monthly bill covering the maximum kilowatts of demand and kilowatthours furnished by the Company for the Customer s use as follows: Transmission Charge Transmission services will be provided pursuant to a separate Service Agreement for Network Integration Transmission service under the Company s Pro Forma Open Access Transmission Tariff. Generation Charge $0.02320 Net per Kilowatthour Fuel Cost Adjustment A fuel cost adjustment shall apply to all kilowatthours billed under this Rate Schedule. The adjustment shall be $0.0000 per kilowatthour from January 1, 1997 to January 1, 2002. Beginning January 1, 2002, the adjustment shall be determined by the following formula to the nearest 0.001 cent per kilowatthours: A = Fm - Fb x L x 1 Sm Sb 1 - T A= Fuel cost adjustment in cents per kilowatthour. Fm = Fuel cost in the current period relating to: (a)Fossil and nuclear fuel consumed in generation in wholly-owned and jointly-owned stations and identifiable fossil and nuclear fuel costs in energy purchased, plus the net energy cost of energy purchased on an economic dispatch basis, less (b)Fossil and nuclear fuel costs recovered through intersystem sales. All fuel costs will be those charged to Account 501, cleared through Account 151 and Account 518 in the second calendar month preceding the billing month. Sm = All killowatthour sales to regular Customers in the Current Period. Fb and Sb= Fuel cost and kilowatthour sales in the base period as defined above. The factor Fb = 1.200 cents per kilowatthour. Sb L = Adjustment factor to recognize losses to service voltage where different than average losses in the delivery system. This factor is 1.00. T = The jurisdictional Gross Receipts Tax rate in effect during the billing month, expressed as a decimal. OTHER PROVISIONS In taking service from the Company under this Rate Schedule, the Customer agrees that the load imposed by the Customer on the Company s electrical system shall have approximately the same or higher load factor and power factor as that experienced by the Customer for the Customer s entire load. Bills remaining unpaid thirty days from the day of mailing shall thereafter bear simple interest at the rate of one-half of one percent per month. APPLICABLE GENERAL TERMS AND CONDITIONS Articles 1 through 14, except Article 3.1 as modified later in this section, of the Company s Rules and Regulations which govern the supply of wholesale service, as included in the FERC Tariff and as changed from time to time, apply to this Rate Schedule and are hereby incorporated by reference. The initial term of the Electric Service Agreement, as contained in Article 3.1 of the Rules and Regulations of the Electric Tariff, is hereby modified: The initial term of the Electric Service Agreement shall be from January 1, 1997 to January 1, 2002. This Electric Service Agreement may be terminated at the end of the initial or subsequent terms by either party giving three months prior written notice to the other of such termination. This Rate Schedule is made subject to the jurisdiction of any governmental authorities having jurisdiction in the premises, and either party may, at any time or from time to time, unilaterally take any action before or with such authorities with respect to any rates, terms, conditions or services of this Rate Schedule that it deems desirable, and in such event, the rates, terms or conditions under which service shall be rendered hereunder shall be those authorized by such authorities.
